doc.repnme: International Finance Corporation (IFC) annual report 2009 : their/our story - creating opportunity where it ' s needed most
doc.abstracts: International Finance Corporation (IFC) moved quickly, engaging with clients to help them adapt to the new economic environment. IFC created an array of initiatives to address immediate needs and to mobilize funding for critical sectors, like infrastructure, banking, trade finance, microfinance, as well as new advisory services programs. IFC also created a fund to draw private investment into Africa's health sector. In total, IFC raised over $5 billion in funding for crisis initiatives this past year, an affirmation of IFC's strong brand and reputation. In 2008, the clients provided 2.1 million jobs, served 5.5 million patients, and helped educate 1.2 million students. The clients reached over 200 million water, power, and gas customers, provided phone connections to 220 million people, and provided 9.8 million loans to micro, small, and medium enterprises. IFC strengthened the managerial capabilities of small and midsize firms in many countries, helping train thousands of entrepreneurs through the business edge and small, medium enterprises toolkit programs. IFC laid the foundation for future mobilization of private capital for development with the historic launch of a subsidiary to manage commercial funds.
